title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Monday 28 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: second man in court after body found in bin .
community hospitals could be sold under new plans .
climber in 'serious condition ' after falling from cliffs near land 's end .
a379 crash pedestrian 's injuries `` not life threatening or life-changing '' .
rise in five to seven year olds receiving free flu vaccine .
bryan adams to perform in devon .
£ 500,000 is to be spent on flood defences in a part of north devon .
yacht left in the middle of a road in cornwall .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on tuesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: road repairs funding only 'scratches the surface '
text: central government funding being given to devon county council for road repairs have been given a `` cautious welcome '' .
the department for transport is making £ 70m available from the pothole action fund .
devon will receive just over £ 3m in the next financial year - estimated to be enough to repair 60,200 potholes .
any additional funding is a help , of course , and it shows that the government 's listening , but this barely scratches the surface .
we need more support to start to make a real difference to the condition of our road network which , at 8,000 miles , is the biggest highway network of any local authority in the country . ''
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: plymouth parking fees to go up in biggest shake-up for five years
text: parking charges are going up across the city - and disabled drivers will have to pay to stay in all council-run car parks .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'large amount of cash ' taken in armed robbery
text: a 'large amount of cash ' was stolen from hatt service station and post office on saturday evening .
police said a man , who was wearing a motorcycle helmet with a balaclava underneath , was armed with a knife and forced the staff member to open the safe .
officers are appealing for help to find the suspect described as white , about 5ft 5ins tall and of slim build .
they are also keen to trace the driver of a light-coloured hatchback-style car , who was nearly involved in a collision with the vehicle the suspect drove away from the service station in saltash .
author: Ben Chapple
BBC News Online

documents.title: watch this man lead a spontaneous mass singalong on plymouth train
text: merry train passengers making their way back to plymouth from a cornish beer festival decided to make the most of their journey - by breaking into a spontaneous carriage singalong .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: epic paddleboarder charlie head docks in st ives
text: paddling does n't come harder than this !
epic adventurer charlie head dropped into st ives on his way around the england and wales coastline .
charlie head from the isle of wight , set off from london on 27 june with only his board , a tent and some emergency supplies to raise money for environmental and mental health issues .
he travelled up the east coast of england before coming down the west coast of england and wales and reckons he will have covered 1,860 miles when he reaches land 's end .
he completed the 620 miles land 's end to london leg of the route in 2012 .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : watch out for freezing fog patches
text: after a dry and bright end to the day , we 'll hold onto the clear skies tonight , allowing temperatures to fall away and a widespread frost to develop .
the light winds will lead to some freezing fog patches forming too , particularly through the taw valley and across bodmin moor .
minimum temperature : -1c ( 30f ) .
after a frosty start to tuesday , it 'll be another fine and dry day with plenty of sunshine , but despite the sunshine it will feel cold .
maximum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .

documents.title: st ives porthgwidden beach was swept away by the waves of storm angus
text: children in st ives could n't resist a spot of beach-surfing on the steep embankment left behind by the sea at porthgwidden .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: controversial bus gate scheme could be overturned
text: a lawyer has said truro 's controversial bus gate scheme could be overturned in the courts because cornwall council did n't listen to local objections .
michael orlick has been appointed by kenwyn parish council to challenge the legalities of the plan to install a special bus lane on the main road coming into truro at threemilestone .
he said he 's had some previous success in cases like this and hopes the case can be resolved without legal proceedings .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police appeal for witnesses after burglary in newton abbott
text: police in newton abbot are appealing for witnesses following a burglary that happened at an address near the junction at clifford avenue on exeter road in kingsteignton .
officers said the incident took place between 13:20 and 15:45 on 22 november 2016 .
cash amounting to approximately £ 800 was taken from the property along with a brown/fawn suede jewellery box .
police are appealing to anyone that may have witnessed sus persons or activity in these areas to come forward .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: new music festival grinagog set to bring world class artists to torquay
text: a brand new music festival featuring world class artists will held in torquay next year .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: cornwall 's community hospitals could be sold
text: some of cornwall 's community hospitals could be sold to pay for new urgent care centres under plans that have just been released .
cornwall 's so called sustainability and transformation plan aims to avoid a combined budget deficit of £ 264m by the end of the decade .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: ikea 'stands behind ' brexit vote
text: swedish flat pack furniture giant ikea has reiterated its commitment to investing in britain following the brexit vote , as its sales continue their upward trajectory .
uk boss gillian drakeford told the press association the retailer `` stands behind '' the country 's decision to quit the european union , with plans for new stores still in the pipeline .
the company opened a store in reading earlier this year and plans to set up shop in sheffield , greenwich and exeter .
it is also trialing four smaller click and collect stores .
author: Press Association

documents.title: truro city get huge fa trophy tie
text: truro city will face national league leaders forest green rovers in the first round of the fa trophy .
the white tigers have been rewarded for their 6-1 qualifying round win over frome town with arguably the hardest possible fixture in the draw .
meanwhile torquay united have also been drawn away to national league opposition in the form of braintree town in the first round of the fa trophy .
ties will be played on saturday 10 december .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: man in hospital with broken jaw after nightclub assault
text: a man ended up in hospital with a broken jaw after an assault in a plymouth club , police have said .
officers were called in the early hours of sunday 20 november to union street after a 24-year-old man was injured while on the dancefloor at the walkabout club .
police said the man was attacked from behind between 00:45 - 01:00 in an unprovoked assault .
they are appealing for witnesses .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: nicholson unhappy with gulls ' attitude
text: torquay united manager kevin nicholson says his side 's attitude in training ahead of their loss to tranmere rovers contributed to the result .
the gulls beat solihull moors for a first win in nine , but nicholson was unhappy with the attitude afterwards .
`` we came in after beating solihull and too many of the team looked like they 'd made it , '' nicholson told bbc devon .
`` you should be in on thursday and you should be head down , let 's get ready to go and beat tranmere . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: sports coach robert spends £ 5,000 on emergency op to save his dog 's life
text: sports coach robert dawson had to act quickly when his shih tzu benjamin suffered a sudden back injury .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: cornish charity appeals for donations for syrian refugees
text: a cornish charity 's appealing urgently for donations of essential baby items such as nappies and wipes as well as food to send to refugees in syria .
open hearts open borders is sending another container out to the war-torn country .
the charity has collection points across cornwall .
and has already sent three containers .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: driver on a39 near camelford flips car over and destroys it in crash after swerving to avoid a fox
text: a driver had a lucky escape from a crash which completely wrecked his car after he swerved to avoid a fox and collided with a hedge on the a39 .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: argyle 'ahead of schedule ' - adams
text: plymouth argyle manager derek adams has urged supporters not to panic despite a third successive defeat .
the pilgrims were seven points clear at the top of league two , but are now in second place after losing at morecambe .
`` we 're a team that transformed over the closed season and we 're ahead of schedule , '' adams told bbc radio devon .
`` we 've won more games than anyone else in this league , some people need to have a reality check .
we 're not barcelona or man city , we 're plymouth argyle .
we 're working really hard , we 've got good players in the dressing room and i 've already stated before we 're punching well above our weight . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: risk of ice tomorrow morning
text: cold night , treating whole 1600 mile network with 1145miles retreated again tomorrow morning , risk of ice with run off from hedges/fields hg

documents.title: arsonists target charity shop in devonport during early hours of this morning
text: fire crews and police were called to devonport in the early hours of this morning after a suspected arson attack at a charity shop .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: two burglaries in same street
text: police are appealing for information after two burglaries in the same street in torpoint .
two properties were broken into in cross park between 16 and 20 november .
police said offenders forced a double-glazed window at the back of one property and forced a door open in the second raid .
a number of collectable coins , service medals , a set of cufflinks and two wrist watches were all stolen in the first burglary .
despite causing £ 300 worth of damage to the door in the second raid , no items were stolen .

documents.title: christian legal centre defends teaching assistant
text: libby powell from the christian legal centre defends teaching assistant victoria allen who was disciplined for expressing her religious beliefs regarding same-sex marriage to a 14-year-old pupil .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornwall 's palm trees 'could be under threat from weevil '
text: there are fears cornwall 's palm trees could be under threat from a weevil that 's been discovered in britain for the first time .
the red palm weevil - a type of beetle - was first spotted at a nursery in essex .
experts fear it could breed and settle in the south west because of the mild climate .
the bug 's already wiped out palm trees along the french riviera and the mediterranean .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: second man in court after body found
text: a second man has appeared in court charged with the murder of james woodhouse ( below ) in exeter .
thomas killen , 32 , of north lawn court , exeter , appeared before plymouth magistrates ' court via a video link to exeter 's heavitree road police station .
he was remanded in custody and is due to appear at exeter crown court on wednesday .
last week brett williams edwards , 37 , of okehampton road , exeter , was also charged with the murder of the 30-year-old fundraiser .
a third man , 47 , was also arrested on sus of murder and he has been bailed by police until february while inquiries continue .
edwards is due to appear at exeter crown court again on 22 december .

documents.title: 'punished for biblical beliefs '
text: a group supporting a teaching assistant with a claim against a cornish school says she 's been punished for sharing her biblical beliefs with a pupil .
the christian legal centre is supporting vicky allen who was disciplined by brannel school , st austell for telling a 14-year-old boy she did n't believe in gay marriage .

libby powell is a case worker with the group and said outside bodmin magistrates ' court that mrs allen `` hopes to get an apology and recognition that she did n't do anything wrong by answering a question based on her biblical beliefs '' .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: community hospitals could be sold under new plans
text: some of cornwall 's community hospitals could be sold under new plans released today .
cornwall 's new five-year deal aims to avoid a budget deficit of £ 264m by the end of the decade by providing more care at home and helping with lifestyle changes .
there are also proposals to install new urgent care centres in cornwall .

phil confue is the chief executive of cornwall partnership nhs foundation trust said `` we have to live within our financial means '' but `` it does n't mean we ca n't do things better for the people of cornwall '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: redruth secure dramatic win at worthing
text: redruth boss marek churcher has praised the bravery of the stand-in referee who made his side retake what proved to be a match-winning conversion .
the reds won 29-27 at worthing , but only after angus taylor 's conversion in stoppage time was retaken having initially hit the post .
the touch judge , who had taken over after the referee was injured , deemed worthing charged too early .
`` that 's one of the gutsiest calls , '' churcher told bbc radio cornwall .
`` credit to him because it would have been quite easy to say 'game over ' , but he did n't and gus slotted over the next one . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: a379 crash pedestrian 's injuries 'not life threatening or life-changing '
text: a 41-year-old man from brixham has sustained head and back injuries following a crash involving a van that closed the a379 .
police and ambulance were called to 7.30am following a collision between a ford transit van and a pedestrian on the a379 at hillhead , brixham .
police said the man was airlifted to derriford hospital by devon air ambulance and his injuries are not life-threatening or life-changing .
officers said the road was closed but re-opened around 10.15am .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: campaign against new mobile phone mast in wembury
text: there 's a growing campaign in a devon village against a new mobile phone mast proposed for local playing fields .
o2 wants to put the mast inside new floodlights on playing fields at wembury , to improve 4g coverage , and the parish council is due to discuss the plan tonight .
local people say they are worried about the effect on their children 's health .
o2 says all its base stations operate well within guideline safety limits and below these guidelines there is no evidence of adverse health effects for any members of the public .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall : b3205 slappers hill is closed
text: devon : on the a38 exeter bound between ashburton and drum bridges there are delays due to a slow moving wide load .
devon : at hillhead the b3205 slappers hill is closed near the a379 at due to an incident .
cornwall : near st austell on a391 between stannary road and scredda roundabout there are temporary traffic lights due to roadworks with slow traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: pirates get rare doncaster victory
text: cornish pirates coach gavin cattle was pleased to have seen his side win at doncaster for just the second time since 2011 after a 36-25 win .
toby may , tom duncan and skipper chris morgan scored tries for the pirates as they moved up into sixth place in the championship , a point off their hosts .
`` i 'm really pleased with how they stuck to it , '' cattle told bbc radio cornwall .
`` we 've been up here on the wrong end of a result here lots of times , so it 's another good building block . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: serious crash involving van and pedestrian closes road
text: serious crash involving van and pedestrian closes road
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: teaching assistant 'felt like a criminal ' over gay couple views
text: a teaching assistant is challenging the decision of a cornish school to discipline her for telling a 14-year-old student she does n't believe in gay marriage .
victoria allen also told the student at brannel school in st austell she is unhappy with the rainbow symbol being used to represent gay pride .
she says she expressed her biblical beliefs when the student asked her personal opinion .
she is seeking to overturn the decision to give her a written warning that 's on her record for 12 months .
the hearing is taking place at bodmin magistrates ' court this morning .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter 's 'most dangerous roads ' revealed in details of every crash for a year
text: details of every road accident in exeter over a 12-month period have been revealed , and highlight which are our 'most dangerous ' roads .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: cash and jewellery stolen in plympton raid
text: cash and jewellery have been stolen from a home in plympton .
police said the offenders forced open the back patio door to get inside the property in woodford avenue between 14:55 and 16:45 on 21 november .

officers said : `` once inside they made an untidy search of the home before stealing a quantity of cash , a pandora bracelet containing various charms including a unicorn and angel wings , plus four gold rings .

`` one ring contains a band of four lilac stones , another contains a band of three rubies while a gold engagement ring carries a large opal with six to seven stones around ; one stone is missing . ''
police said about £ 400 worth of damage was also caused to the back door .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: public involvement in royal marine exercises
text: members of the public will be taking part in exercises with the royal marines today to prepare the commandos for deployment to war-torn countries .
several naval vessels will be staging landings on looe beach .
the royal marines one assault group will practice rescuing casualties and around 30 volunteers from looe will take part .
some will pretend to be injured , but others will act as hostile forces , blending into the crowd .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man has jaw broken in unprovoked attack in plymouth club
text: a man has had his jaw broken after a nasty , unprovoked assault in a plymouth nightclub .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: yacht left in the middle of a road
text: a 35ft yacht was left abandoned in the middle of a road in falmouth over the weekend and could have caused a serious accident , police have said .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: truro city ease through in fa trophy
text: truro city manager lee hodges says he is pleased that his side did not repeat their poor fa cup showing as they beat frome town 6-1 in the fa trophy .
it was a first cup victory of the season for truro , who went out of the fa cup after a 4-0 loss to lower-league winchester city in september .
`` the boys have carried on the good work of the past few weeks , '' said hodges .
`` we spoke about winchester in the fa cup and how disappointing it was to go there and put in the kind of performance that got us knocked out .
`` i did n't want us to do that in the trophy , i wanted us to carry on the good work that we 've been doing , '' he told bbc radio cornwall .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: breakingsecond man charged following death of james woodhouse
text: a second man has been charged with murder following the death of 30-year-old james woodhouse , devon and cornwall police said .
mr woodhouse 's body was discovered in a wheelie bin in okehampton road , exeter , on monday 21 november .
thomas killen , 32 from north lawn court , exeter , has been charged with murder and is due to appear at exeter magistrates ' court today .
brett williams edwards , 37 , from okehampton road , exeter , was charged with murder last week and has been remanded in custody to appear before exeter crown court on 22 december .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest headlines in devon and cornwall
text: latest headlines in devon and cornwall
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon to receive money to support mothers with mental health
text: devon is one of 20 areas across the country that will receive money to provide more support for pregnant women and new mothers with severe mental health problems .
nhs england is spending £ 40m on specialist mental health workers over the next five years .
new devon , south devon and torbay clinical commissioning groups are among those who will benefit .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: climber in 'serious condition ' after falling from cliffs near land 's end
text: a climber 's understood to be in a serious condition in hospital after falling from cliffs near land 's end .
emergency services were called to cribba head at 12:30 yesterday .
the climber was airlifted to derriford hospital in the coastguard helicopter .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online

documents.title: bryan adams to visit powderham castle for 'special show '
text: bryan adams will perform in devon next summer .
the canadian singer will perform at powderham castle on thursday 13 july as part of his get up tour .
i 'm delighted to be continuing my tour and heading to exeter next summer .
it 's going to be a special show and i hope my fans are able to join me . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: half-a-million pounds to be spent on flood defences
text: half-a-million pounds is to be spent on flood defences in a part of north devon .
braunton has been flooded on a number of occasions including in 2012 ( below ) .
people living there can go to a public meeting this lunchtime to see what 's planned .
work could start in january .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: breakingserious crash involving van and pedestrian closes a379
text: the a379 is closed at hillhead , # brixham , due to a serious collision between a van and pedestrian .
slappers hill will be shut for some time .

documents.title: dog owners are being warned of deadly palm oil fatbergs washing up on beaches in cornwall
text: dog walkers are being urged to watch out for potentially deadly 'fatbergs ' which are washing up on beaches following storm angus .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: teenager helps cornish charity
text: teenager helps cornish charity
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: man dies after collapsing at coach station
text: a man has been pronounced dead after suffering a cardiac arrest at a coach station .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: today 's weather : fine and dry with increasing amounts of sunshine
text: after a cloudy start across parts , there will be increasing amounts of sunshine developing throughout the day .
staying windy along some exposed southern coasts , and despite the sunshine it will feel rather cold , particularly in the wind .
maximum temperature : 12 deg c ( 54 deg f ) .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: bryan adams to perform in devon
text: bryan adams will perform in devon next summer .
the canadian singer will perform at powderham castle near exeter on thursday 13 july as part of his get up tour .
it 's one of just a handful of outdoor shows he 's putting on in the uk next year .
tickets go on sale at 09:00 on friday
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: latest travel in devon : a379 closed at hillhead
text: latest travel in devon : a379 closed at hillhead
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: increase in south west children receiving free flu vaccine
text: there 's been a rise in the number of five to seven year olds in the south west receiving the free flu vaccine .
public health england says over half have now received the vaccine compared to less than 40 % last year .
last winter half of the 440 pupils at glen park primary school in plympton had flu .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for monday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Claire Jones
BBC News Online
